alert.note: Alert for Lower Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 4:24PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Burlington and southwestern Monmouth Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 424 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pemberton, or 18 miles south of Trenton, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Holly, Bordentown, Pemberton, Wrightstown, Jobstown, Columbus, Jacksonville, Georgetown, Leisuretowne, Florence-Roebling, Fieldsboro, Pemberton Heights, Fort Dix, McGuire AFB and New Egypt. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 6, and between exits 7 and 7A. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 51 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southern and central New Jersey...and southeastern Pennsylvania.
